description: From Middle English stutten, stoten (“stutter”); cognate with Dutch stotteren (“stutter”).

entries.meaning: A speech disorder characterised by stuttering.

verbs.description: stutter (third-person singular simple present stutters, present participle stuttering, simple past and past participle stuttered)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To speak with a spasmodic repetition of vocal sounds.
examples: He stuttered a few words of thanks.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To exhaust a gas with difficulty
examples: The engine of the old car stuttered going up the slope. I was stuttering after the marathon.
